alert.note: Alert for Espanola Valley; Jemez Mountains; Santa Fe Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 2:21PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF LOS ALAMOS, EAST CENTRAL SANDOVAL AND NORTHWESTERN SANTA FE COUNTIES THROUGH 245 PM MDT... At 221 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cochiti Pueblo, or 21 miles northeast of Bernalillo, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Santa Fe, Los Alamos, White Rock, Santo Domingo Pueblo, Kewa Pueblo, Cochiti Pueblo, La Bajada, La Cienega, Frijoles and Bandelier National Monument. This includes Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 273 and 279. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: Espanola Valley; Jemez Mountains; Santa Fe Metro Area
